channel.title: Deb file downloader of all already installed software
channel.description: well I would like to have a program that downloads all of the installed packages and makes a list of what has been installed, that can be used with like, kinda how some apps can send a command to Adept(package manager) and it would install all the packages under that command. so I can reinstall my applications when I do a fresh format soon.

item.title: Deb file downloader of all already installed software
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Modified mopman’s command a bit to replace all of the newlines with spaces, enabling you to open the file in a text editor, ctrl-a, ctrl-c, then open a terminal, type 'sudo aptitude install ', press shift-insert (paste) and hit enter.

apt-cache pkgnames | tr ‘\n’ ’ ’ > pkgnames.txt

Read full topic
item.source: Deb file downloader of all already installed software

item.title: Deb file downloader of all already installed software
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

awesome. it worked. Now I just need to know “how do I make the package manager install all of these at once?”

well I also have PSP toolchain, DVD/video editing stuff, and several other things that are worth backing up and not going through the pain of trying to get the right stuff dependency wise.

item.title: Deb file downloader of all already installed software
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Well I don’t know about Adept but with pacman you can go “pacman -Q” and it lists all packages on my system. I don’t know if adept has a similar command? I’m sure it does…maybe ask around the Ubuntu forums?

Would this really even be necessary?

I mean you install java…flash…and go from there.

Read full topic
